task: Identify a Specialization on Coursera that teaches C++ programming for beginners, provide the name and what the learning outcomes are.
user_action_and_explanation: type 'C++ programming Specialization' in the search bar with the placeholder text 'What do you want to learn?' to find courses related to C++ programming for beginners.
observation: The search results show several Specializations. One that teaches C++ programming for beginners is "Coding for Everyone: C and C++" offered by the University of California, Santa Cruz. The learning outcomes include gaining skills in the C programming language family, computer programming, programming principles, algorithms, data structures, C++ programming, computational logic, and more. It is a beginner-level Specialization that takes approximately 3-6 months to complete.
